title: Financially Comfortable | 1 of 2
question_text:
A community organization wishes to know the proportion of subjects who feel financially comfortable in a certain town.
Based on last year’s census, $64\%$ of the residents in this town felt financially comfortable. This year, in a sample of $60$ randomly chosen subjects, $39$ say they feel financially comfortable.
I f indeed the subjects’ economic opinions have NOT changed from last year, describe the sampling distribution of the proportion of those who feel financially comfortable.

choices.text:
Shape: unable to tell
Center: mean = 0.65
Spread: standard deviation = 0.06197

Shape: approximately normal
Center: mean = 0.64
Spread: standard deviation = 0.06158

Shape: exactly normal
Center: mean = 0.65
Spread: standard deviation = 0.06197

Shape: left skewed
Center: mean =
0.64
Spread: standard deviation =
0.06158

Shape: approximately normal
Center: mean =
0.64
Spread: standard deviation =
0.06197
